content: in first st ch1 skip next st single_crochet in ch1-space ch1 skip next st single_crochet ch2 single_crochet in ch2-space ch1 skip next st single_crochet ch1 skip next st 2sc in last st ch1 turn row 4 rs cc single_crochet in first st ch1 skip next st moss st to ch2-space single_crochet ch2 single_crochet in ch2-space ch1 skip next st moss st to last st 2sc in last st change to mc ch1 turn row 5 ws mc single_crochet in first st ch1 skip next st moss st to ch2-space single_crochet ch2 single_crochet in ch2-space ch1 skip next st moss st to last st 2sc in last st ch1 turn row 6 rs mc single_crochet in first st ch1 skip next st moss st to ch2-space single_crochet ch2 single_crochet in ch2-space ch1 skip next st moss st to last st 2sc in last st change to cc ch1 turn row 7 ws cc repeat row 5 row 8 rs cc repeat row 6 except change to mc ch1 turn row 9-102 repeat row 5-8 23 more times then repeat row 5-6 once more but do not turn your work at the end of row 102 and do not change color from this point forward you will work the border in rounds instructions - border partial round 1 rs mc refer to photos below working down the longest edge ch1 single_crochet in same st as previous 2sc ch1 *single_crochet in space between the edge sts where cc-to-mc color change occurred ch1 single_crochet in space between the edge sts where next mc-to-cc color change occurred ch1* repeat from *to* up to the magic_ring single_crochet into side of st before the magic_ring ch1 single_crochet into side of st after the magic_ring ch1 repeat from *to* back to beg single_crochet ch1 single_crochet in first single_crochet of row 101 slip_stitch directly into first single_crochet of row 102 no chain between the last and first single_crochet cut yarn fasten_off and sew in yarn end cc-to-mc mc-to-cc cc-to-mc cc-to-mc mc-to-cc cc-to-mc note be sure to keep your yarn gauge neutral to slightly loose when working along the longest edge to prevent the edge from puckering and becoming tight lula faye pearl shawlette t designed by michelle hillmeyer 2 round 2 rs cc from opposite corner where cc is still attached bring up loop in ch1-space near corner working along longest edge first ch1 single_crochet in same ch1-space ch1 skip next st moss st to opposite corner until you reach the 2sc in one st from the previous row see photo below 2sc in one st maintain moss st pattern by placing single_crochet in first of the 2sc ch1 skip next single_crochet single_crochet in ch1-space ch1 skip next st moss st until ch2-space single_crochet ch2 single_crochet in ch2-space ch1 skip next st moss st back towards starting corner until you reach the 2sc in one st from previous row skip first single_crochet single_crochet in second single_crochet ch1 single_crochet in next ch1- space ch1 skip next st continue moss st
